ar.com.hjg.pngj

Class BufferedStreamFeeder

  • java.lang.Object
    • ar.com.hjg.pngj.BufferedStreamFeeder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class BufferedStreamFeeder
extends Object
implements Closeable
    Reads bytes from an input stream, and feeds a IBytesConsumer.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BufferedStreamFeeder(InputStream is)
      By default, the stream will be closed on close()
      BufferedStreamFeeder(InputStream is, int bufsize)

    • Method Detail

      • getStream

        public InputStream getStream()
        Returns inputstream
        Returns:
        Input Stream from which bytes are read

      • feed

        public int feed(IBytesConsumer consumer)
        See Also:
        feed(IBytesConsumer, int)

      • feed

        public int feed(IBytesConsumer consumer,
                int maxbytes)
        Tries to feed the consumer with bytes read from the stream, at most maxbytes

        It can return less than maxbytes (that doesn't mean that the consumer or the input stream is done)

        Returns 0 if premature ending (no more to read, consumer not done)
        Returns -1 if nothing fed, but consumer is done

      • feedAll

        public long feedAll(IBytesConsumer consumer)
        Feeds as much bytes as it can to the consumer, in a loop.
        Returns bytes actually consumed
        This will stop when either the input stream is eof, or when the consumer refuses to eat more bytes. The caller can distinguish both cases by calling hasPendingBytes()

      • feedFixed

        public int feedFixed(IBytesConsumer consumer,
                     int nbytes)
        Feeds exactly nbytes, retrying if necessary
        Parameters:
        consumer - Consumer
        nbytes - Number of bytes
        Returns:
        nbytes if success, 0 if premature input ending, -1 if consumer done

      • refillBufferIfAppropiate

        protected void refillBufferIfAppropiate()
        If there are not pending bytes to be consumed, tries to fill the buffer reading bytes from the stream. If EOF is reached, sets eof=TRUE and calls close() Find in pendinglen the amounts of bytes read. If IOException, throws a PngjInputException

      • hasPendingBytes

        public boolean hasPendingBytes()
        Returuns true if we have more data to fed the consumer. This might try to grab more bytes from the stream if necessary

      • setCloseStream

        public void setCloseStream(boolean closeStream)
        Parameters:
        closeStream - If true, the underlying stream will be closed on when close() is called

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes this object. Sets EOF=true, and closes the stream if closeStream is true This can be called internally, or from outside. Idempotent, secure, never throws exception.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • setInputStream

        public void setInputStream(InputStream is)
        Sets a new underlying inputstream. This allows to reuse this object. The old underlying is not closed and the state is not reset (you should call close() previously if you want that)
        Parameters:
        is -

      • isEof

        public boolean isEof()
        Returns:
        EOF on stream, or close() was called

      • getBytesRead

        public long getBytesRead()
